meanings.sent1: Her coquetry was evident in the way she batted her eyelashes at him.
meanings.sent2: The coquetry of the young woman caught the attention of many admirers.
meanings.sent3: During the party, her coquetry led to some playful banter with the guests.
meanings.sent4: The coquetry of the wind as it danced through the trees was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: His coquetry was like a colorful butterfly fluttering from flower to flower.

meanings.definition: The act of flirting or behaving in a flirtatious manner
meanings.sent1: She engaged in coquetry by coyly smiling at him from across the room.
meanings.sent2: His coquetry was charming and made everyone feel at ease.
meanings.sent3: The coquetry between the two friends was all in good fun.
meanings.sent4: The coquetry of the waves as they caressed the shore was enchanting.
meanings.sent5: The cat's coquetry with the toy mouse was playful and entertaining to watch.
